attributes.comment:
I am writing in regard to the proposed fee increase for adoption paperwork. My
husband and I have completed 2 international adoptions since 2000 and are
currently waiting to complete our third. We have seen the fees increase twice and
this current fee increase will make it exceptionally difficult on us for two reasons.
First, the financial burden for adopting parents is already substantial, increasing
these fees just makes it even harder. Second, due to lengthening process times
with the China International Adoption program, we will be forced to re-do our
adoption paperwork through BCIS, thus incurring more costs. I do not understand
why these fees are necessary. Certainly, they don't need to increase by as much
as proposed. Please consider that most people adopting are not in the upper tax
bracket, many moms stay home to raise their children an the costs of adoption
already in place are hard enough on most families including ours. Had we been
able to have natural births, the cost to us would have been a mere $100 per child.
The cost per child that we have adopted has been $25,000. I encourage you to
seriously consider the points of view from the adoption community and not pass
these fee increases.

Sincerely,
Sarah E. Williams
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sarah Williams
